overview:
Niko Waesche is a media consultant, entrepreneur and 15-year internet veteran - with lots of scars and bruises. In 2011, he founded GMPVC German Media Pool, a company that invests in high growth consumer businesses using an innovative media for equity barter model.

Niko also is an angel investor in several internet and technology companies, such as the translation search engine Linguee.com and Debitos.de, the online marketplace for receivables.

Previously, Niko was Executive Partner at IBM and ran the Northern European Media & Entertainment Practice. Before IBM, Niko established one of the first U.S. venture capital funds in Germany, GRP Partners. At the time, Niko was a regular columnist of the Financial Times Deutschland.

Niko is co-author of “SimplySeven,” a guidebook to sustainable internet business published by Palgrave Macmillan. His first book, “Internet Entrepreneurship in Europe,” discussed the failure of European start-ups during the New Economy.

Niko is Venture Partner of Deutsche Telekom’s seed investment fund hub:raum. Niko also is a Member of the independent German Think Tank Stiftung Neue Verantwortung. He serves on the IBC Conference Committee (2012, 2011, 2010).
